headline.main: SAYS AT SPY TRIAL HE AIDED DEFENSE; Reuper, Defendant, Holds That His Work Compensated for Data Sent to Reich STATEMENT READ TO JURY Trial Enlivened by Near-Fight and Challenge to Real One by Opposing Counsel

lead_paragraph: Carl Alfred Reuper, a former trusted employe of Air Associates, Inc., and the Westtnghouse Electric Company transmitted inconsequential information to Germany in return for past favors, but more than compensated for this by his contributions to the United States defense program, according to testimony yesterday in the Brooklyn espionage trial.
abstract: C A Reuper testifies his aid to Air Assocs and Westinghouse Elec defense efforts offset data sent Germany; F J Walsh, defense atty, and Asst U S Atty J D Saver clash, Bklyn
